CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 23, 1955, pg. 9, reads: "For a Grand Lady - The Courier each week receives a great pleasure in awarding five dollars to the churchgoing person circled in pictures taken at the district churches, but it will derive extra enjoyment just to meet and honor this grand lady when she comes into the office to receive the gift. All she has to do to receive the award is to visit the Courier any time next week between Monday and Friday during working hours, identify herself, and name the church from which she is leaving. - Harris Photo." (The woman eighth from left is circled in newspaper).
TitMainTitle: Crowd of men, women, and children, including little girl in center wearing light colored dress, descending stairs of Warren Methodist Church, 2604 - 2606 Centre Avenue, Hill District
